thread.title: Flavor your week with these 5 food events: Pop-up, Colombian, BBQ
thread.title_full: Flavor your week with these 5 food events: Pop-up, Colombian, BBQ

author: Tim Reardon
title: Flavor your week with these 5 food events: Pop-up, Colombian, BBQ
text:
Flavor your week with these 5 food events: Pop-up, Colombian, BBQ Here's our 5 food picks for the first official full week of October. Flavor your week with these 5 food events: Pop-up, Colombian, BBQ Memphis Taproom (2331 E Cumberland St.) (Yong Kim // Staff photo) Travel Deals Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015, 2:35 PM 
Here's our 5 food picks for the first full week of October. 
The Philadelphia Museum of Art (2600 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy.) gets into the seasonal spirit with a Oktoberfest pop-up beer garden on Wednesday, Oct. 7 . Beginning at 6 p.m., hang out with Yards' Lady Birds Club and enjoy local brews, bratwursts, and art displays. For a good cause: Non-profit organization Glenside UCC (2160 Wharton Rd.), who raises funds to help citizens of Colombia, will host a benefit dinner on Saturday, Oct. 10 . Dinner reservations are available at 5:30 and 7:30 p.m. and will feature Latin-themed dishes.On Saturday, Oct. 10 Memphis Taproomâ€™s (2331 E Cumberland St.) backyard is open for their Thirstoberfest . The celebration runs from noon to 6 p.m. and rare and local brews by Yards, Firestone Walker, Allagash, Russian River, and more. Besides all the beer, special hot dogs will be available for purchase at the location's food truck. Grey Lodge Tavern (6235 Frankford Ave.) is teaming up with Sixpoint Brewing Company for a weekend brunch . Happening on Sunday, Oct. 11 , they will also be offering hackberry trees for adoption. All you have to do for a tree is to register and call 215-856-3591 . Beers, though, do not require registration. Things get started at 10 a.m. Workout before you pig out! The Pedal Pushas Philly Bike Crew and Community Bikes and Boards presents Bike and BBQ 3 , city wide 5k ride. The event on Sunday, Oct. 11 starts at Drexel Park (31 and Powelton) at 4 p.m. After the cruisning around town, get your eat on at Community Bikes Shop (712 S 4th St.) with a delicious smoky feast. Tickets can be purchased here . For more Things to Do, check out our calendar for the most up-to-date happenings.
